entry.title: Re: Dynamic mapping of 3rd party applications with SAP Bu...
entry.content:
To enable dynamic mapping between any third-party application (Shopify, Magento, etc.) and SAP Business One using SAP CPI, these steps can help - 

1. Use a metadata-driven mapping approach stored externally (e.g., JSON or database) that defines how fields from each third-party application's data structure map to SAP Business One fields. This metadata can be updated or switched when changing the third party without needing to recreate mappings in CPI.

2. SAP CPI supports integration flows where you can invoke dynamic message transformation using external scripts or lookups against a central mapping repository (JSON files or records) to apply the appropriate mapping based on the source system.

3. Use SAP CPI to connect to various 3rd party systems (Shopify via GraphQL, Magento via APIs) and use integration processes that retrieve data from these systems, apply the dynamic mapping based on the metadata for the current 3rd party, and push into SAP Business One.

4. Staging tables or intermediate steps can be used for complex transformations, allowing you to manipulate and validate data once fetched before final persistence.

5. The JSON file or mapping repository holds mapping rules (field mappings, transformations, conversions) for each 3rd party source. When switching from Shopify to Magento, you update the mapping metadata file rather than changing CPI integration code.

6. Integration platforms like appseconnect or celigo, and approaches recommended in SAP forums align with this pattern, promoting reusable, flexible integration logic with externalized mappings for multiple eCommerce and ERP systems.

This approach minimizes redundant work and enhances integration flexibility and maintainability and the design provides a scalable, low-maintenance dynamic mapping solution for integrating various third-party apps with SAP Business One via SAP CPI.

entry.title: Struggling to Choose the Right Cloud ERP Solution ‚Äî Need Expert Opinions!
entry.content:
Hey everyone,

I‚Äôm hoping to tap into the collective wisdom of this community because I‚Äôm currently stuck in a major decision phase for our company‚Äôs digital transformation journey.

We‚Äôre a mid-sized manufacturing firm, and our decade-old on-premise ERP system is no longer cutting it. Between manual processes, limited integration, and zero scalability, it‚Äôs clear we need to move to a Cloud ERP solution ‚Äî but picking the right one has been way more challenging than expected.

Here‚Äôs our current situation and what we‚Äôre trying to solve

  • We need better integration between ERP, CRM, and production systems.
    Our team is distributed across multiple locations ‚Äî so remote accessibility is key.
  • We‚Äôre looking for real-time reporting, automation, and AI-driven insights.
  • Our staff isn‚Äôt very tech-savvy, so the user experience and training process matter a lot.
  • We have a moderate budget ‚Äî cost efficiency and transparency are top priorities.

The Challenges

  • Integration complexity: We already use a custom CRM and a legacy production system.
  • Data migration: Our current data is scattered and not well-structured.
  • User adoption: Our workforce isn‚Äôt used to major tech shifts.
  • Implementation cost and timeline: We‚Äôve seen horror stories about ERP projects going over budget and schedule.

What I‚Äôd Love to Hear From You

If you‚Äôve recently implemented or migrated to a Cloud ERP (especially in manufacturing, supply chain, or retail), could you share:

  • How did you choose your vendor and what tipped the decision?
  • What hidden challenges came up during migration and rollout?
  • How long before you saw tangible ROI or operational improvements?
  • Any mistakes or lessons learned you wish you knew earlier?

entry.title: Re: How to use Time Recording Calendar for submitting Tim...
entry.content:
Yes, based on our understanding, the matching mechanism works for both current and past timesheets‚Äîeven when the timesheet dates overlap within the calendar dates. This behavior is as designed. Currently, it does not support future timesheets, as we haven‚Äôt encountered such use cases from other customers so far. It appears to be a niche or unique scenario.

Regarding the statement:
‚ÄúProblem comes with a payroll area that is paid up-to-date. For that group of people, the time data needs to be made available in advance, as they need a lot of time to complete their payroll process.‚Äù
I‚Äôm not entirely clear on the business case here. Specifically, what does ‚Äúa lot of time‚Äù mean in this context? It might be related to process efficiency on the payroll side, and perhaps there‚Äôs an opportunity to evaluate whether certain payroll tasks could be automated to reduce time pressure.

That said, since this seems to be a one-off case occurring annually, you might consider a workaround using Integration Center to trigger notifications for employees and admins on a specific day via MDF alerts. This would at least ensure that relevant stakeholders are informed in advance and can submit the necessary timesheets accordingly.

Example : https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/timely-time-sheet-alerts-for-no-records-on-previous-working-day/ba-p/13509861

entry.title: Join the Data and Analytics Value Map on SAP Community
entry.content:
SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps have moved to SAP Community. Join us now in the SAP Community Groups to stay up to date and informed on the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio for Data and Analytics, ranging from Expert-guided implementation (EGI) sessions, Continuous Quality Check (CQC) services, E-learnings, SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council pilot programs and more.

The Data and Analytics Value Map provides guidance for solutions including SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP Databricks, as well as SAP BusinessObjects. To see our new look in the SAP Community, watch the short SAP video (1 min, 30): SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps on SAP Community

 

How to Access

  • To access the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Group, you must login to SAP Community with an S-user ID or a Universal ID
  • Navigate to us via the tab ‚ÄúGroups‚Äù, then ‚ÄúCustomer Only Groups‚Äù or via our dedicated page: SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps

  • Once in the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Group, select the Data and Analytics Value Map and click ‚ÄúJoin Group‚Äù
  • Expand the ‚ÄúOptions‚Äù button and click ‚ÄúSubscribe‚Äù to get email notifications of activity within the group
  • Why join and subscribe? To set customization preferences, get notifications, participate in the group and have a better user experience

 

Blog Posts

We will continue to post blogs to let you know about availability of new and updated content in the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio, such as new E-Learnings, events taking place, best practices, and other relevant information for the Data and Analytics topic.

 

Knowledge Base

Our Knowledge Base is a collection of documents, which provide both foundational information and in-depth guidance for SAP Data and Analytics topics including SAP Business Data Cloud. These focused documents organize the Expert-guided implementation (EGI) sessions, Continuous Quality Check (CQC) services, E-learnings, best practices, and more by topic. Making it easier for you to see in one place the SAP Enterprise Support offerings by topic and/or solution area. Here are three Knowledge Base directories to bookmark within the Data and Analytics Value Map:   

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Directory
  • SAP Data Warehousing Directory
  • SAP BusinessObjects BI 2025 Directory

 

Q&A

Use the Q&A section to ask us questions or find questions that have already been answered. For example, maybe you need guidance on how to find best practices and make use of the SAP Enterprise Support offerings for your project such as a BW modernization in SAP Business Data Cloud. The following could be relevant for you: 

  • EGI for SAP BW Modernization with SAP Business Data Cloud
  • CQC for Private Cloud Go-Live 
  • CQC for Implementation
  • CQC Technical Performance Optimization (TPO)
  • CQC Business Process Performance Optimization (BPPO)
  • CQC for Security Optimization
  • CQC for Data Volume Management

Full details are in the Knowledge Base SAP BW Modernization with Foundational Support

 

Events

The monthly EGI schedule will be populated here giving details of the planned EGI topics, dates, time, regions and languages.

 

Request a Call

Request a call with one of our topic experts to connect with the right content and resources.

 

LIVE SESSIONS on SAP Enterprise Support value maps ‚Äì Our Move to SAP Community

Join this live session on October 22, 2025, to learn more, where we will demo SAP Enterprise Support value maps on SAP Community. üîó Link to join / Watch Replay

 
Enhance Your SAP Experience with Value Maps 

SAP Enterprise Support offers additional resources to help you drive innovation. SAP Enterprise Support value maps provide expert-led resources, tailored recommendations, and advisory services - all included in your SAP cloud subscription. Get started today:

  • One-time sign up for SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, using a valid S-User ID (please allow up to 2 hours for processing)
  • Access SAP Enterprise Support value maps for personalized guidance
  • Request a call with our solution area experts for tailored advice

Value Maps are part of SAP Enterprise Support commitment to your success. Visit the SAP Enterprise Support value maps landing page to explore our range of topics and start engaging with us today.

 

About the author: 
Caroline Sheridan is a Topic Expert for SAP Enterprise Support value maps, specializing in SAP Data and Analytics.‚ÄØWith a tenure of 12 years at SAP, Caroline‚Äôs expertise lies in assisting and guiding customers to succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings. 

üí°Have questions or feedback on this content? Feel free to leave a comment below or submit them in the Q&A section.

entry.title: Multiple email sent for custom email notification onboarding
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I have a requirement to notify respective division's HRBP when an onboardee selects "Yes" to COI Declaration Form (custom MDF object added to additional onboarding data collection step).

Because there are 8 divisions, I have created 8 email categories, 8 email triggers and 8 email templates in Email Services.

I have inserted a filter business rule to each of the 8 email templates whereby the IF condition will determine which division will receive the email.

At the object definition > Process, I have created another business rule whereby once additional onboarding data collection step is completed and if Onboardee selects "Yes" to the COI declaration form, the email template created in Email Services will be triggered.

Upon testing, I noticed that the recipient receive 8 of the same email notification, and I thought maybe it is because under Object Definition > Process, I have combined all 8 divisions email templates into the "THEN" section in the business rule.

Therefore I decided to create 8 different business rules instead, but the same outcome is seen.

The reason why I put the division filter in the email template in email services is because the Business Rule iplaced under Object Definition > Process is unable to pick up the onboardee's division, i have used rule trace to determine this.

Anyone experience the same thing?

Attached Words doc is how config is done.

@Gopinath_Murugaiyan  any idea? Thank you.

entry.title: Re: What is the menu Migrate in transaction SMOD?
entry.content:
NEVER MIGRATE CUSTOMER EXITS IN SMOD (unless you have created a Z Enhancement in the transaction SMOD, which has been done very rarely by the customers I know).

Only the owners of the definitions of Customer Exits (in SMOD, they are also called Enhancements) should migrate them. If they don't migrate them, you don't have to migrate your own implementations of Customer Exits (CMOD).

If the owners are SAP or other ABAP software providers and they have migrated the definitions of Customer Exits (via the menu "Migrate" in SMOD), the customers will be informed by SPAU (when using it to upgrade SAP software) to migrate the implementations, that's not related to the menu "Migrate" in SMOD.

The note 915122 - Migration of customer exits not allowed in customer systems - SAP for Me says:

  • The migration of the definition side must be executed only by the software provider.
  • The use of transaction SMOD for the migration of SMOD enhancements to BAdIs is prohibited.
  • Therefore, the relevant pushbuttons in transaction SMOD are missing in customer systems.
  • You can use the ok codes "MIG" or "MIGW" to execute or undo the migration.
  • A migration of SMOD enhancements may result in significant development efforts.
  • In this case, however, SAP cannot guarantee further support.

For information, the first screen in SMOD contains the two migration buttons, they are NOT displayed in customer systems, but they are displayed in SAP-owned systems (there's the module MIGRATION_ONLY_AT_SAP in SAPMSMOD):

entry.title: Fiori Adaptation project Manage Purchase Order V2 to navigate directly to the create PO screen
entry.content:
Dear community, 

Within my company we do have the requirement to directly open the create purchase order screen from the Manage Purchase Order V2 app. However there's no semantic object and action available to do so.

 

I tried the next approach:

  • Create Adaptation project via BAS (Business Application Studio)
  • Create extension controller
  • Implement below code in the method onAfterRendering
sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        // ,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        // ,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton", {
            // metadata: {
            // 	// extension can declare the public methods
            // 	// in general methods that start with "_" are private
            // 	methods: {
            // 		publicMethod: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.Instead /*default*/
            // 		},
            // 		finalPublicMethod: {
            // 			final: true
            // 		},
            // 		onMyHook: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.After
            // 		},
            // 		couldBePrivate: {
            // 			public: false
            // 		}
            // 	}
            // },
            // // adding a private method, only accessible from this controller extension
            // _privateMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a public method, might be called from or overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // publicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding final public method, might be called from, but not overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // finalPublicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a hook method, might be called by or overridden from other controller extensions
            // // override these method does not replace the implementation, but executes after the original method
            // onMyHook: function() {},
            // // method public per default, but made private via metadata
            // couldBePrivate: function() {},
            // // this section allows to extend lifecycle hooks or override public methods of the base controller
            override: {
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
                // 	 * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                onInit: function () {
                    console.log("Adaption Bart is triggered.");

                },
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Similar to onAfterRendering, but this hook is invoked before the controller's View is re-rendered
                // 	 * (NOT before the first rendering! onInit() is used for that one!).
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                // 	onBeforeRendering: function() {
                // 	},
                // 	/**

entry.title: Re: BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT does not show errors if no...
entry.content:
Solved.

there was this field missing MVT_IND = 'F'

With it, if there is an error in stock available at the storage location, the BAPI returns an error. Without it, the BAPI can still save the movement, therefore my mistake while using it.

entry.title: SAP‚Äôs New Logistics Management Module: A Cloud-Native Approach to Smarter Regional Supply Chains
entry.content:
What Is SAP Logistics Management?

SAP Logistics Management is a modern SaaS-based logistics solution built on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
It brings together warehousing, transportation management, and partner collaboration in a single, integrated system ‚Äî particularly suited for regional or satellite operations ‚Äî while connecting seamlessly with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Network.

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Key Attributes

  • Cloud-native: Designed for seamless scalability, continuous innovation, and rapid deployment.
  • Unified logistics approach: Combines warehouse, transport execution, orchestration, and partner collaboration into one platform.
  • Native ERP integration: Connects easily with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP S/4HANA without heavy customization.
  • Carrier & partner collaboration: Built-in connectivity through the SAP Business Network for real-time visibility and data sharing.
  • AI-powered operations (Joule): Leverages SAP Joule AI assistants to automate tasks, guide decisions, and reduce manual workload.

In short, SAP Logistics Management doesn‚Äôt replace heavy-duty logistics systems like SAP EWM or SAP TM, but rather extends SAP‚Äôs portfolio with a lighter, agile, intelligent logistics layer ‚Äî ideal for regional warehouses and distributed networks.

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Core Capabilities & Business Impact

 

Function

Business Impact

Warehouse & transport execution

Reduces manual coordination and errors

Real-time visibility

Enables proactive decision-making

Dock & appointment scheduling

Improves yard efficiency

AI-guided automation

Speeds up repetitive tasks

Integrated partner collaboration

Boosts transparency across the supply chain

 

Feature Highlights

Feature Area

What It Enables

Why It Matters

Warehouse execution

Pick/pack, wave management, dock scheduling, inventory movements

Smooth internal operations, less idle time

Transportation & dispatching

Route planning, dispatching, and execution

Better shipment coordination

Network collaboration

Real-time status, carrier integration, partner communication

Reduces blind spots, accelerates response

Appointment & dock scheduling

Dock/gate management

Reduces queuing, improves yard efficiency

AI automation (Joule)

Decision support, task automation

Frees up planners and boosts productivity

ERP integration

Out-of-the-box connectivity with SAP Cloud ERP

Minimizes custom development

Scalable deployment

Rapid implementation for smaller logistics nodes

Supports multi-tier logistics networks

 

Positioning Within the SAP Ecosystem

SAP positions this module as a bridge for distributed logistics operations, extending logistics capabilities to smaller or regional nodes. It complements ‚Äî not replaces ‚Äî SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) and SAP Transportation Management (TM).

Where It Fits:

SAP Product

Complexity

Ideal For

Deployment

SAP EWM

High

Central hubs

On-prem / Cloud

SAP TM

High

Complex transport networks

On-prem / Cloud

SAP Logistics Management

Medium / Low

Regional / Satellite nodes

Cloud-native

Because it‚Äôs built on SAP BTP and integrates with SAP Business Network and Joule AI, the new module aligns with SAP‚Äôs vision of an intelligent, integrated supply chain.
SAP announced that general availability is expected in Q1 2026.

Benefits & Business Value

Adopting SAP Logistics Management can deliver both operational and strategic gains:

  1. Reduced operational friction: Unified logistics reduces manual handoffs and integration gaps.
  2. Faster deployment for regional nodes: Cloud-native architecture enables quicker rollouts and lower implementation costs.
  3. Improved visibility & collaboration: Real-time tracking and partner integration enhance transparency and agility.
  4. AI-driven decision support: Joule AI assists planners, automates routine actions, and reduces human error.
  5. Scalable, modular growth: Deploy gradually across logistics nodes without disrupting existing core systems.
  6. Resilient and agile operations: Respond faster to disruptions and maintain consistent service levels.
  7. Network consistency: Standardized processes and data across multiple logistics layers ensure global alignment.

Key Challenges & Considerations

While promising, success depends on thoughtful execution.
Organizations should anticipate and plan for:

  • Scope & complexity limits: The module is optimized for low-to-medium complexity; large hubs may still need EWM + TM.
  • Data integration & master data quality: Consistent, clean master data is critical for seamless performance.
  • Change management: AI-driven workflows require user adoption and training.
  • Phased rollout strategy: Identify pilot nodes and migration paths carefully.
  • Carrier & partner readiness: True collaboration depends on network adoption.
  • Monitoring & exception handling: Maintain human oversight during early automation phases.
  • Cost vs. ROI alignment: Evaluate expected efficiency gains against investment costs.

 

What Businesses Should Do Next

If your organization already runs SAP Cloud ERP or S/4HANA, this launch presents a real opportunity to modernize logistics without starting from scratch.

Recommended Next Steps

  • Map your logistics footprint: Identify which regional or satellite nodes would benefit most.
  • Start with pilot deployments: Test configurations, training, and ROI in smaller sites.
  • Ensure data readiness: Clean up and harmonize master data across materials, locations, and partners.
  • Engage carriers early: Align carriers and logistics partners with the collaboration network from the start.
  • Plan coexistence: Integrate with existing EWM/TM during the transition phase.
  • Adopt AI in stages: Roll out automation features gradually and monitor outcomes.
  • Track KPIs from day one: Measure order throughput, dock utilization, exception rates, and on-time delivery.

Conclusion 

The introduction of SAP Logistics Management marks a pivotal step in SAP‚Äôs supply chain evolution ‚Äî moving toward networked, intelligent, and modular logistics.

With its cloud-native architecture, AI-powered automation, and embedded collaboration, it offers a compelling value proposition for companies with multi-tier logistics footprints.

Ultimately, success will depend on data readiness, partner engagement, and phased adoption ‚Äî but for organizations ready to embrace intelligent logistics, SAP is clearly paving the way for smarter, more connected supply chains.

Thank you for reading.

entry.title: Employee Business Partner Archival, Deletion, and Recreation in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Introduction
In SAP, Business Partners (BPs) are central master data objects shared across multiple modules. This blog explains how to safely delete and recreate an Employee Business Partner using a new number range‚Äîwithout affecting the employee record or related applications, while also allowing the old number range to be reused for other Business Partners, such as customers and vendors.

Step-by-Step Resolution
Step 1:  Delete Communication Detail (Infotype 105 Subtype 0001) from Employee
To delete Infotype 105 (Communication Details) and Subtype 0001 (System User): For a single employee, go to transaction PA30, select the infotype(105) and subtype (0001), then click the Delete icon. For mass deletions, LSMW can be created and used.

Step 2:  Decouple BP and User
Although we deleted the communication details in the previous step, the Business Partner remains connected to the User ID. To disconnect the Business Partner from the User, run the standard program RSUID_REMOVE_FALSE_BP_ASGN in transaction SE38. Enter the User ID in the input field and execute the program. Then, select the record, click "Convert", and choose "Convert to Classic User".

 



Step 2 can only be executed if Step 1 has been completed.If not, you will receive the following error: "No users found in the selected area."

‚ö†Ô∏è  After this step, the email address and telephone number will be removed from the user in transaction SU01. To restore this information efficiently, you can use LSMW to perform a mass import of those details.

Step 3:  Set Deletion/Archiving Flag
Go to transaction BUPA_PRE_DA. Enter the Business Partner number in the Business Partner input field. Select the "To be deleted" radio button. Check the boxes for "Can be deleted" and "Can be archived". Select the "Set Flag" radio button. Click Execute.

Step 4: Remove CP (Central Person) and BP (Business Partner) Relationship
The Central Person (CP) is a technical object used to uniquely link an employee‚Äôs personnel record (PERNR) to other related objects like User and Business Partner. The Central Person is automatically generated by the system. This is stored in the HRP1001 table.
The relationship between BP and CP is B207. Get the CP ID from the HRP1001 table for the desired Business Partner. This can be deleted using the standard program RHRHDC00.


Step 5: Set Central Block / End of Purpose (EOP)
Prerequisite:

  • ILM configurations must be in place to execute this step.
  • If any changes are made to the Business Partner, the central block cannot be applied on the same day ‚Äî it must be performed on the following day.
  • If business partner is locked in any applications or open transactions, EOP cannot be executed.

To set central block, go to transaction BUPA_PRE_EOP, Give the business partner ID and execute.

Step 6:  Write Archiving File
Go to transaction SARA and enter CA_BUPA in the Archiving Object field. Choose the WRITE option and create a variant.  Provide the Business Partner ID that has to be deleted, set ILM Actions to Archiving, and select the execution mode ‚Äî either Production or Test.

Once done, click on Attributes at the top and enter a suitable description, then save again. Set the Start Date to Immediate and define the Spool Parameters as LP01. Execute the job, then navigate to Job Overview, open the Spool List, and review the results.

Step 7:  Delete the Archived File
Once the archiving file is written, go to transaction SARA again. Select CA_BUPA in the Archiving Object field and choose the DELETE option. The file created in the previous step will be displayed. Select it and execute the deletion.



Step 8: Set New Number Range
Go to transaction SNRO and set a new number range.

Step 9:  Create Communication Detail (Infotype 105 ‚Äì Subtype 0001)
To create Infotype 105 (Communication Details) and Subtype 0001 (System User): For a single employee, go to transaction PA30 and create Infotype 105 with Subtype 0001. For mass creation, an LSMW can be created and used.

Step 10:  Run BP Sync Program
Run the BP sync program /SHCM/RH_SYNC_BUPA_EMPL_SINGLE with the desired Employee ID. A new Business Partner will be created and synced with the User.

Conclusion
By following these steps, you can safely delete and recreate Employee Business Partners without terminating any employee records. The End of Purpose (EOP) report helps identify open transactions preventing deletion. Once recreated under a new number range, conflicts are resolved and the old range becomes reusable for other Business Partners.



Sources:
BP Archival and deletion using SARA: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/archiving-of-business-partner/ba-p/13858643

Business Partner Number Range Configuration: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-s-4hana-business-partner-general-number-settings/ba-p/13529505

ILM Configuration: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-schedule-an-ilm-job-for-deleting-employee-data/ba-p/13875544

Set Archiving and Deletion Flag using BUPA_PRE_DA:
 https://help.sap.com/docs/TRBK_S4HANA_EARLIER/29cd80be37ea41bab809abb791cea909/4e8e95bc034f1f35e10000000a42189d.html?locale=en-US

Remove the Business Partner and User Relationship using the standard program RSUID_REMOVE_FALSE_BP_ASGN  : Delete BP for existing Employee and User in S/4HAN... - SAP Community

Delete BP and CP Relationship: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/report-to-delete-om-objects/qaq-p/5508187

End of Purpose: 
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_SUPPLIER_RELATIONSHIP_MANAGEMENT/c8a1f0f380454446bb88b07dee132c73/4dc8387e27e14814be489df740119966.html?locale=en-US

entry.title: How to Mark Materials for Deletion in SAP Ariba Product Sourcing (Related to DMS-18783)
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

We're investigating whether it's possible to delete or deactivate Product Sourcing materials that are no longer in use or were mistakenly uploaded. We found documentation about Product Sourcing functionality DMS-18783, which prevents materials marked for deletion from appearing in product sourcing searches and being added to product sourcing events.
DMS-18783: Prevent Adding Deleted Materials to Product Sourcing Events | SAP Help Portal
This suggests there's a way to mark materials for deletion in Product Sourcing, but we haven't been able to find how to do so. We'd greatly appreciate your feedback on whether this is possible.
If this isn't possible, we'd greatly appreciate information on how other customers work around the inability to delete materials in Product Sourcing, including any operational workarounds they use.

What we've tried so far:
We tested in our demo system and contacted SAP Support, but haven't found a solution.

  • We couldn't find documentation on how to mark materials for deletion.

  • SAP Support confirmed that Sourcing material master data cannot be manually modified via CSV uploads (this is only possible in Procurement solutions like Ariba Buying & Invoicing) and no manual import or delete task exists in the Sourcing admin UI.

  • We marked a test material for deletion in our SAP backend demo system and uploaded it with the incremental load option using the ARBCIG_MASTER_DATA_EXPORT program. However, it was automatically excluded, even though the material was in the sourcing material prefilter.

  • SAP Support confirmed that the deletion flag for materials in S/4HANA isn't automatically processed in Ariba Sourcing. It appears that only programs for uploading B&I master data (such as ARBCIG_BUYER_CATALOG_EXPORT and ARBCIG_BUYER_CATALOG_REPORT) support deletion flag information integration as standard functionality.
    About Processing Purchase Information Records and Material Master Records | SAP Help Portal

We'd appreciate your response. 

Best Regards,
Chinatsu

SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing Suite

entry.title: The Future of Procurement: Unlocking Value Through Business Accelerators with Klaus Fischer
entry.content:
The Future of Procurement: Unlocking Value Through Business Accelerators with Klaus Fischer

In today‚Äôs rapidly evolving business landscape, procurement is no longer just a back-office function‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic driver of growth, resilience, and innovation. This was the central theme of a recent episode of SAP‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Future of Procurement Podcast,‚Äù featuring Klaus Fischer, a veteran SAP leader and board advisor, whose career has spanned engineering, consulting, and transformative acquisitions. Fischer‚Äôs insights offer a roadmap for organizations seeking to unlock value by bridging finance and procurement, embracing technology, and fostering collaboration.

üèõÔ∏è From Engineering to Boardroom: The Journey of Transformation

Klaus Fischer‚Äôs story is emblematic of the evolution within procurement. Starting at SAP‚Äôs headquarters in Germany, Fischer‚Äôs career journey led him from engineering to strategic advisory roles, culminating in his pivotal involvement in SAP‚Äôs acquisition of Ariba‚Äîa move that redefined spend management and procurement for the enterprise. By integrating Ariba‚Äôs cloud-based capabilities with SAP‚Äôs robust ERP solutions, Fischer helped create a seamless, end-to-end platform that empowers organizations to optimize spend, drive compliance, and build resilient supply chains.

üîó Breaking Down Silos: The Power of Finance and Procurement Alignment

A recurring theme in the discussion was the critical need for CFOs and CPOs to break down organizational silos. In a climate marked by low growth, high costs, and regulatory complexity, Fischer emphasized that external pressures‚Äîgeopolitical shifts, tariffs, inflation, and supply chain disruptions‚Äîdemand agile, integrated responses. Internal challenges, such as data silos and manual processes, further hinder agility. The solution? Unified platforms and processes that connect finance and procurement, enabling real-time decision-making and accelerating value realization.

üöÄ Business Accelerators: Unlocking Value Quickly

Fischer introduced the concept of ‚Äúbusiness accelerators‚Äù‚Äîstrategic initiatives that rapidly unlock value across finance and procurement. Mastering working capital, for example, is more critical than ever. By connecting invoice-to-pay and invoice-to-cash processes, organizations can optimize cash flow, reduce risk, and improve key performance indicators like day sales outstanding (DSO) and day payable outstanding (DPO). Change management and governance are essential to overcoming resistance and ensuring successful adoption of new technologies and processes.

ü§ñ AI and Unified Data: The Next Frontier

Looking ahead, Fischer identified AI-powered automation and unified data as game-changers for procurement and finance. SAP‚Äôs embedded AI capabilities‚Äîspanning category management, guided sourcing, spend visibility, and financial close‚Äîenable organizations to achieve dramatic improvements in speed, accuracy, and strategic outcomes. The trustworthiness and precision of enterprise AI are paramount, especially when managing complex, high-value transactions.

üìà Real-World Outcomes and Forward-Looking Insights

When finance and procurement teams collaborate, companies realize tangible benefits: optimized savings, reduced risk, improved compliance, and more effective supplier onboarding. End-to-end workflows and internal controls ensure consistency and resilience, even amid global disruptions. Fischer‚Äôs forward-looking advice for leaders? Embrace agentic AI, automation, and integrated business processes to stay ahead in 2026 and beyond.

üí° Conclusion: Procurement Never Sleeps‚ÄîNeither Should Your Ideas

As organizations navigate uncertainty and transformation, the alignment of finance and procurement, powered by technology and strategic leadership, will be the key to unlocking sustainable growth. The future of procurement is collaborative, data-driven, and relentlessly innovative. What accelerators will your organization pursue next?

Share your thoughts, feedback, and ideas as we continue exploring the future of procurement together.

Please like, share, and subscribe!

entry.title: Re: Process Flow for Asset Intercompany Sale with Revenue...
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

Thank you for your feedback and follow-up

The AAPO149 error 'No depreciation area for receiving the revenue‚Äù happens when the system cannot locate a suitable depreciation area to post the revenue part of an inter company asset transfer.
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, this usually occurs if certain conditions are met.

The Transfer Variant used is not defined as with revenue, or the selected Transaction Type is not properly connected to a retirement with revenue process.

Please try the following:

In the Post Transfer app, across company codes in the same country, select 'with revenue' Transfer Variant 0001 ‚Äì Inter company transfer with revenue.

Use a Transaction Type such as 300  Retirement with revenue.

If no revenue needs to be posted, select the without revenue option and choose the appropriate transaction type, such as 310 ‚Äì Retirement without revenue.

For detailed guidance, please refer to SAP KBA 3471322 ‚Äì Error AAPO149 during inter-company code transfer posting (ABT1N), which also applies to the Public Cloud scenario:

SAP KBA-3471322 - Error AAPO149 occurred during inter-company code transfer posting in transaction ABT1N

2968929 ‚Äì Message AAPO149 occurred in an inter-company posting; the same root cause remedy is from a parallel article. SAP Support Portal-2968929 - Message AAPO149 occurred in transaction ABT1N for intro-company posting

Let me know how it goes

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: BigCommerce seamless integration with SAP Cloud ERP - Complete Setup & Demo Guide
entry.content:
Tired of Juggling Data Between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce? We‚Äôve Got You Covered!

Managing data and business processes across SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition) and BigCommerce can often be a challenging and time-consuming task ‚Äî especially when done manually or through custom-built integrations. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to introduce a ready-to-use integration package powered by SAP Integration Suite, built to simplify and streamline your operations.

Designed specifically for B2C commerce scenarios, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures:

  • Seamless data synchronization between SAP and BigCommerce
  • Automated workflows for key business processes
  • A reduction in manual tasks and potential errors

In this blog, we‚Äôll start with a high-level overview of what the integration offers. Then, we‚Äôll walk you through a step-by-step guide to setting up the package ‚Äî so you can get your systems connected and running efficiently with minimal effort.

Note : SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package accelerator isn‚Äôt just limited to B2C. Partners can extend the integration to support B2B use cases as well, tailoring it to fit the needs of more complex business models. The package is built with extensibility in mind, so partners can enhance it further to accommodate specific business requirements or tailor it to specific industry needs. Partner can enhace the Integration Flows for bidirectional synchronization between BigCommerce & SAP Cloud ERP for the following entities:

  • Products, Price, Discounts & Tax
  • Product Variants ( Recommend customer project to leverage separate Products )
  • B2B Customer Master Data & Payment Settlement Flows
  • Enhance the use-case to cover Promotions and Classification

 

Overview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Integration Package:

SAP provides a variety of pre-built integration accelerators via the SAP Integration Suite, all accessible through the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Among these, we‚Äôve developed a dedicated BigCommerce integration accelerator that enables a seamless connection between your BigCommerce storefront and SAP Cloud ERP and its available with SAP Cloud Integration Suite Starter Edition and Standard Edition.

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures real-time data consistency across both platforms by synchronizing key business objects such as:

  •  üõí  Product information
  •  üì¶  Inventory levels/Product Stock
  • üí≤Product Prices & Discounts 
  •  üë§  Customer information

By automating critical business processes like order creation, cancellations, and returns, the integration reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and increases operational efficiency. It also synchronizes shipping and delivery details, helping you provide accurate and timely updates to customers ‚Äî a key to delivering a superior B2C customer experience.

The BigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud package is designed to integrate key end-to-end business processes between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce, enabling smooth, automated data flow and operational consistency across both platforms.

The following core business processes are supported out of the box:

üì¶ From SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce:

  • ‚úÖ Replicate Products ‚Äì Ensure accurate and up-to-date product information is reflected in your BigCommerce storefront.
  • üìä Replicate Product Stock ‚Äì Keep inventory levels in sync to avoid overselling or stockouts.
  • üí≤ Replicate Product Prices & Discounts ‚Äì Automatically update pricing and promotional details in BigCommerce.
  • üöö Replicate Delivery Details ‚Äì Provide timely and accurate shipping information to your customers via BigCommerce.

üõíFrom BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP:

  • üë• Replicate B2C Customers ‚Äì Capture and transfer customer data from BigCommerce to SAP, enabling centralized customer management.
  • üßæReplicate Orders ‚Äì Seamlessly transfer incoming sales orders into SAP for fulfillment and processing.
  • ‚ùå Replicate Order Cancellations ‚Äì Reflect cancelled orders in SAP for proper stock and financial reconciliation.
  • üîÅ Replicate Order Returns ‚Äì Automatically push return details from BigCommerce into SAP to streamline reverse logistics.

Together, these integration flows deliver a robust, automated B2C commerce experience, reducing manual interventions and ensuring your front-end and back-end systems remain in sync.

üöÄ How to Set Up the ‚ÄúBigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition‚Äù Package

Integrating BigCommerce with SAP Cloud ERP is now easier than ever ‚Äî thanks to the pre-built accelerator available on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. This step-by-step guide will help you configure and deploy the integration package using SAP Integration Suite, so your systems can work together seamlessly.

‚úÖPrerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

  • üîë  An SAP Partner Account with access to SAP Integration Suite (via SAP BTP ‚Äì Business Technology Platform).
  • üßæ Access to SAP Cloud ERP.
  • üõç  A BigCommerce Partner or Merchant Account.SAP Cloud ERP
  • üìò  Basic knowledge of SAP BTP, Integration Suite and BigCommerce . 
  • üåê  Access to SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • üìòDetailed Configure Guide - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Refer to BigCommerce Receiver Adapter | SAP Help Portal

 üõ†Ô∏è  Step 1: Set Up SAP Integration Suite instance using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) account.

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  2. Create a Subaccount and enable Integration Suite:
    • Navigate to your Global Account > Subaccount.
    • Create or open an Integration Suite instance.
    • Assign relevant entitlements and Assign relevant roles
    • Use the Booster Enable Integration Suite to automate setup or configure manually
    • for more details refer to sap help documentation SAP Integration Suite | SAP Help Portal

üì¶ Step 2: Import the BigCommerce Adapter Package into SAP Integration Suite

  1. Goto SAP Integration Suite instance
  2. Go to Discover tab.
  3. Search for ‚ÄúBigCommerce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite‚Äù.
  • Click ‚ÄúCopy‚Äù to add / move the package to your Design workspace.

  • To Configure BigCommerce Adapter Installation - Installing the BigCommerce Adapter is a prerequisite to use the Integration Content. For adapter installation, refer to the ‚ÄúBigCommerce Adapter Guide‚Äù and also refer to section Configure Adapter in Communication Channels and documents section in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

üîÑStep 3: Configure BigCommerce iFlows (Integration Flows) with API access relevant details.

  1. Go to Design > Integrations in the Integration Suite.
  2. Open the imported BigCommerce Integration Package.
  3. Select a relevant iFlow (e.g., Replicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition).
  4. Configure the necessary Externalized Parameters and Connections, referencing the detailed documentation for each Integration Flow.
  5. To Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP - the mandatory configurations which need to be performed in the SAP Cloud ERP before you can start implementing the configuration for BigCommerce API and configuring the Integration Content in SAP Integration Suite and for more details refer to section "Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  6. Sample configuration shown below.

      BigCommerce Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • BigCommerce Base Url: https://<yourshop>.myBigCommerce.com/
  • BigCommerce Secure Parameter: The name of the BigCommerce access token secure parameter 

       SAP Cloud ERP Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Base Url: https://<your-sap-s4-hana-instance-id>-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
  • Credential Name: The name of the SAP Cloud ERP secure parameter 

üß© Example Integration Flows:

  • BigCommerce ‚ûú SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition : Customer Replication, New Orders, Order Cancellations & Returns
  • SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition ‚ûú BigCommerce : Products, Inventory Synchronization, Stock Availability, Delivery Status

üöÄStep 4: Deploy and Test the Integration Package in Integration Suite

  1. Deploy selected iFlows from your Design workspace.
  2. Monitor from Monitor > Integrations > Message Processing Logs.
  3. Perform test transactions: for more details refer to Demo section in the blog
    • Place a test order in BigCommerce.
    • Monitor the message logs and confirm data replication in SAP Cloud ERP: Sales Orders, Business Partners, Product Catalog

üîß Extend or Customize the Package (Optional)

As a partner you can extend or tailor the integration through:

  • Customer Exits to plug-in your custom integration flows (Pre Exits and Post Exits in Intergration Flows)
  • Copy and modify the integration content.
  • Groovy scripts to customize payload mappings.
  • Content Modifiers to apply business logic.
  • Enhanced error handling and alerting.

 üí° Partner Tips & Monetization Opportunities

As an SAP Partner, you can:

  • üí° Extend the integration flows and Build new integration flows using SAP BigCommerce adapter
  • üìú  Demo your solution with real-time order sync and inventory updates, build a demo to show real-time sync between BigCommerce and SAP with custom business case.
  • üß∞ Buildc Multi-Tenant Integration Templates for reuse across customers.
  • üß† Leverage SAP Integration Advisor for intelligent mapping.
  • üí°  Add your branding, services, or vertical-specific enhancements.

High Level Demo Flow to showcase Order processing along with Master data replication.

  • Step 1 : View the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package in Integration Suite
  • Step 2: Show product in SAP Cloud ERP  (to be replicated to BigCommerce)
  • Step 3: Start replication of product in integration suite
  • Step 4: Show replicated product in BigCommerce and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product
  • Step 5: Log into BigCommerce as customer and browse through existing products
  • Step 6: Select the product replicated from SAP Cloud ERP and add to basket
  • Step 7: Enter the relevant details like payment and create order
  • Step 8: Check the order created in BigCommerce
  • Step 9: Replicate the order from BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 10: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as internal_sales_rep and look for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app and open the sales order and change the order date to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Step 11: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as shipping_specialist and open app ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù
  • Step 12: Enter shipping point and enter the sales order and shipping date as todays date and save , note down the Outbound Delivery ID
  • Step 13: Open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter Outbound Delivery ID and enter Actual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter picking quantity as 1 and save
  • Step 14 : Click on Post GI and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to Completely Processed. Note : show the SO Process flow of created order in SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 15 : Replicate the Outbound delivery from SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce.
  • Step 16: Open sales order in BigCommerce and show the OD created in SAP Cloud ERP reflected in metadata fields of Sales order and status of Sales Order is changed to fulfilled.

Detailed Demo steps:

BigCommerce Demo systems include the following systems - Integration Suite Tenant [along with BTP Sub-Account), SAP Cloud ERP, BigCommerce Admin Portal

Step 1:  Access the  Integration Suite tenant and view ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù integration package

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù -> ‚ÄúIntegration‚Äù
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , view the integration flows and details. 

Step 2: Access to SAP Cloud ERP System to show the replicating product master

  • Access system using URL SAP Cloud ERP system as Product Master Specialist
  • Login with user = prodmaster_specialist
  • Launch the App : ‚ÄúManage Product Master Data‚Äù  and search for Product ID  (sample product ID - TG11)
  • Note: in the demo product replication integration flow we are replicating only one product with product ID (sample product ID - TG11) and user could decide to replicate all products / sub-set of products, based on specific functional requirements.

Step 3: Start replication of product in Integration Suite

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Discover -> Integration (only first time)
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> copy the package
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  ,
  • Navigate to ‚Äúartifacts‚Äù and search for integration package ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
    • To deploy => click on the ‚Äú3 dots‚Äù of integration package and select ‚Äúdeploy‚Äù
    • Deploy would start the product replication from SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce

Step 4: Show replicated product in BigCommerce and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product

  • Login using URL : BigCommerce
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúProducts‚Äù
  • Check and prepare the product for selling to customer
    • Check the product is replicated
    • Check the Stock, Price (Default Price) , SKU (Product ID in S4 Public)
    • Check the product Inventory Details (Current Stock)  
    • Add the picture to publish 
    • Make sure to change the visibility status of product from "Disabled" to "Visible"
    • Note: only the product visibility status is "Visible" can be sold .
  • ‚ÄúSave‚Äù the product

Step 5: login to BigCommerce as customer and browse through existing products

Step 6: select the product replicated from SAP Cloud ERP and add to basket

  • Navigate to "Orders" -> "All Orders" 
  • Click on "Add" 
  • In the first step of order creation, enter the "Customer Info" , enter the "Existing Customer" / "Create New Customer" 
  • Search for the "Existing Customer" and Select the Currency
  • Enter the Billing Information 
  • Add the Product , Search for the existing replicated Product
  • Click on Next
  • Select the Fulfillment, 

Step 7: enter the relevant details like payment details

  • Select the Payment Provider, Card Type, Expiration Date details
  • Enter the Credit Card Holder Name, Credit Card Number, 
  • Click on "Save and Process Payment"  , order would be placed         

Step 8: check the order created in BigCommerce

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù -> "All Orders" 
  • Check the order created with status ‚ÄúAwaiting Fulfillment‚Äù , note down the ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Order ID‚Äù  , order ID would be used to search order created in SAP Cloud ERP system      
  • Note: SAP Cloud ERP Order ID can be found "Metafields" 

Step 9: replicate the order from BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Replication of orders in status Unfulfilled would be moved to SAP Cloud ERP .
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù      

Step 10: Log into SAP Cloud ERP system as Sales Representative

  • open for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app
  • open the sales order and check the order details
  • To create outbound delivery" follow detailed steps in step 11   
     

Step 11: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as Delivery shipping specialist and complete the delivery of Sales Order

  • open for ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù app

Step 12: Enter the key details like Shipping Point and Sales Order ...

  • enter shipping point sample as 3310 (select shipping point relevant for your use-case) and enter the sales order ID create earlier and Selection Date (select the relevant delivery date)
  • click on ‚Äúcontinue‚Äù and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù
  • note down the outbound delivery ID

Step 13: Delivery shipping specialist will pic the outbound delivery

  • open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù id and enter ‚ÄúActual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 22/10/2025) , enter ‚Äúpicking quantity‚Äù as 1 and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù         

 

Step 14 : Delivery shipping specialist will Post Goods Issue for the corresponding outbound delivery

  • click on ‚ÄúPost GI‚Äù and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to ‚ÄúCompletely Processed‚Äù.      

 

Note : show the Sales Order ‚ÄúProcess flow‚Äù of created order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition for the corresponding order, the process flow gives visual representation of business entities created in the system (Order, Outbound Delivery, Invoice ‚Ä¶)

 

Step 15 : replicate the Outbound delivery from S4 public to BigCommerce .

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Delivery Details from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Replication of outbound delivery from SAP Cloud ERP system would be moved to BigCommerce and corresponding Order status would updated to ‚Äúfulfilled‚Äù in BigCommerce
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù         

Step 16: open sales order in BigCommerce and check the  status of Order, it should be changed from ‚ÄúAwaiting Fulfillment‚Äù to ‚ÄúShipped‚Äù

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù
  • With the successfully delivery , the order should be fulfilled and order status should be ‚ÄúShipped‚Äù ,
  • note the fields ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Order ID‚Äù  and ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Outbound Deliveries‚Äù  in order would be copied from SAP Cloud ERP system , the custom fields can be found as part of "Metadata App" (as shown in the below snapshot)      

     

The above steps completes the High Level Demo Flow which showcase the order processing along with product master data replication.

Note: The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package covers Order Returns and Order Cancellation business scenarios along with Order Processing, please feel free to explore the other business process like Order Returns and Order Cancellation .

entry.title: how to use custom business object created in Fiori App in select statement(SAP MDG)
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

Task : For deriving plants automatically in creating material CR.

However, we would like to create a custom business object(referring to plant custom table, created already) in Fiori App, then create CDS view and use that in select statement .

If any one implemented this, could you share the process or steps i should follow.

 

 

regards

Chandra.
